title: Sri Lanka prime minister says he's willing to resign amid tumultuous protests
Police chief says Jayland Walker was handcuffed after fatal police shooting in accordance with department policy
description: The Akron, Ohio, police chief said the handcuffing of Jayland Walker after he was shot dozens of times by city police officers was in accordance with department policy, but added the city will review its policy.

title: 4-year-old girl was killed in a shooting in Akron, Ohio
description: A 4-year-old girl was killed and a man is "clinging to life" following a shooting Friday night in Akron, Ohio, a city that has been reeling from protests over the fatal police shooting of a Black man nearly two weeks ago.

title: Oprah's father Vernon Winfrey has died
description: Vernon Winfrey, Oprah Winfrey's father, died late Friday, Oprah announced in a statement. He was 89.

title: Shawn Mendes postpones tour to focus on his mental health
description: Shawn Mendes has postponed his world tour to focus on his health.

title: Elena Rybakina wins Wimbledon women's singles title, her first grand slam and first for Kazakhstan
description: Elena Rybakina won the women's singles final Wimbledon on Saturday, claiming her first grand slam title and the first for Kazakhstan.

title: Why Campbell Soup hated, then embraced, Andy Warhol's soup can paintings
description: Sixty years ago today, the pop artist Andy Warhol unveiled a wall of 32 Campbell Soup can paintings at a Los Angeles gallery, one for each flavor of soup then in production.

title: Must-see places in Patagonia
description: For travelers itching to go on an adventure, to reconnect with nature or to feel like they are the only humans for miles and miles, Patagonia is one of the last untouched places on Earth.

title: Oklahoma City Zoo rejoices with birth of critically endangered Sumatran tiger twins
description: Twin newborn Sumatran tiger cubs are bonding with their mother, having been born minutes apart early on July 2 at the Oklahoma City Zoo.

title: 'The ghost of the forest' and other animals living in a land of extremes
description: Let's venture to one of the few wild places left on the planet.

title: Protesters take a swim in presidential pool after storming palace
description: Hundreds of thousands of protesters broke into the presidential palace in Sri Lanka. The country has been facing a food, fuel, and medicine shortage not seen in 70 years. The country declared bankruptcy only days ago.

title: Musk tells Twitter he wants out of deal to buy it. Twitter says it will force him to close the sale
description: Elon Musk wants to terminate his $44 billion deal to buy Twitter — the latest in a whirlwind process in which he became the company's biggest shareholder, turned down a board seat, agreed to buy the social media platform and then started raising doubts about going through with the deal.

title: Exclusive: California fire officials and FBI are targeting illegal drones near wildfire emergencies
description: Just one rogue drone is all it takes to bring the aerial assault on a wildfire to a standstill. So in a fresh alliance, the Los Angeles County Fire Department and the Federal Bureau of Investigation's Los Angeles field office are working together in a first-of-its-kind drone deterrent program to get them out of the sky.

title: Netflix releases home reno show with a spicy twist
description: The Fourth of July hit differently this year with all that's going on in our nation.

title: Trump considering waiving executive privilege claim for Bannon but prosecutors say he was never shielded
description: Donald Trump is considering waiving executive privilege for Steve Bannon, according to two sources familiar with the situation, but federal prosecutors don't believe the former President's privilege claims shielded his longtime political adviser in the first place.

title: An hour away from Highland Park, Chicago's South and West sides grieved an even higher death toll
description: Angela Gregg's 4-year-old son, Mychal Moultry Jr., known to loved ones as MJ, was killed by a stray bullet while getting his hair braided last year during Labor Day weekend in Chicago's South Side neighborhood Woodlawn.

title: In pictures: Former Japanese Prime Minister Shinzo Abe
description: Former Japanese Prime Minister Shinzo Abe was assassinated Friday while giving a campaign speech on a street in Nara, Japan.

title: 'When the bombing starts, I don't know where to hide': Ukrainian living on the frontlines
description: More than forty towns and villages in the Donbas region have come under attack in the last 24 hours, as the Russians push into the Donetsk region. CNN's Alex Marquardt  is in Kharkiv to see how the most vulnerable live on the front line of the Russian invasion as Ukrainian forces prepare to push back.

title: Matches at a 4,700-seat stadium -- Are UEFA and the FA selling women's football short?
description: Attendances in women's football have undergone a remarkable rise in recent years and, across the world, records have tumbled.

title: 5,000 pounds of meth seized in San Diego County after truck is followed after crossing border, officials say
description: More than 5,000 pounds of methamphetamine were seized this week after authorities in San Diego County tracked and intercepted a truck that crossed the US border from Mexico, officials said Friday.

title: Boris Johnson was Kyiv's darling. Now that he's leaving, Ukraine fears what's next
description: When Boris Johnson finally announced he would step down as UK Prime Minister on Thursday, after desperately trying to cling onto power despite a historic government rebellion, his decision sparked a sense of relief across Westminster.

title: US dollars will go further on European vacations right now
description: This week in travel news: What it takes to master one of the world's most difficult airport landings, Japan's picky penguins and why US travelers might want to consider a trip to Europe this year.

title: Abe's body arrives back in Tokyo, as police question suspected gunman
description: The body of former Prime Minister Shinzo Abe arrived back at his home in Tokyo on Saturday, a day after he was was assassinated in a daylight shooting, sending a nation unaccustomed to gun violence into a state of shock and anger.

title: Black women say they are invisible in abortion rights fight. 'We are still forgotten within all of this'
description: For many Black women, the reversal of Roe v. Wade last month not only stripped them of bodily autonomy, but created another barrier to economic security and choosing the course of their future.

title: Weekend warriors are lowering their risk of early death, study says
description: Weekend warriors can still stave off disease even if they are packing their workouts into a couple of days, according to a new study.

title: Fire threatens more than 500 giant sequoia trees
description: A growing wildfire that threatens a famed giant sequoia tree grove in California's Yosemite National Park has forced officials to issue evacuation orders for a nearby community, officials said Friday.

title: Tony Sirico, 'Sopranos' star, dead at 79
description: Actor Tony Sirico, who is best known for playing henchman Peter Paul "Paulie Walnuts" Gualtieri on HBO's "The Sopranos," has died, according to his manager Bob McGowan.

title: Abortion unavailable in most cases in Mississippi and Louisiana as bans take effect
description: Abortion services have stopped in Mississippi and Louisiana now that so-called trigger laws enacted by the states are in effect following the US Supreme Court's decision to overturn Roe v. Wade.

title: Filmmaker faces death threats over controversial Hindu goddess poster
description: A Toronto-based filmmaker says she has received a deluge of death threats and abuse from Hindu nationalists in India after she depicted the goddess Kali smoking a cigarette.

title: Simulation shows tsunami waves as high as 42 feet could hit Seattle in minutes
description: A simulation released by the Washington State Department of Natural Resources (DNR) shows the impact of a 7.5-magnitude earthquake on the Seattle Fault.
